title: Definitions
context: F. Nursing Scholars Program [ยง304A-3301] Definitions. As used in this subpart, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Approved course of study&rdquo; means a course of study that leads to enrollment in a graduate nursing program approved by the state board of nursing or a course of study in a graduate nursing program approved by the state board of nursing. &ldquo;Approved educational institution&rdquo; means a public post-secondary educational institution located in this State that has been accredited by a nationally recognized accrediting agency that is listed by the United States Secretary of Education. &ldquo;Program&rdquo; means the nursing scholars program. &ldquo;Student&rdquo; means any individual domiciled in this State who attends or is about to attend a post-secondary educational institution located in this State leading to a master&rsquo;s or doctoral degree in nursing and who intends to teach in a nursing program in Hawaii designed to prepare students for licensure as registered nurses. &ldquo;Work requirement&rdquo; means teaching at a school of nursing located in Hawaii after receiving a master&rsquo;s degree or doctoral degree in nursing. [L 2006, c 75, pt of ยง2]
